location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description (used for referencing) commences at f 530, and terminates at f 537, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 530 -536; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file comprises correspondence between officials of the Ministry of Health, London, and the Under-Secretary of State, Foreign Office, London, relating to quarantine arrangements for Persia and the attitude of the Persian quarantine authorities.The file includes 'A note by Sir George Buchanan on a conversation with the Persian representative at the Office International d'Hygiene Publique concerning the imposition of quarantine on the Persian-Irak [Iraq] frontier referred to in Sir R H Clive's despatch of October 18th, 1930, and relevant correspondence' (ff 532-534).
